bill_title: establish a consumer compensation and education fund related to telecommunication services and to provide for expenditures from the fund.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a consumer compensation and education fund related to telecommunication services and to provide for expenditures from the fund. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 49-31 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The commission shall establish a consumer compensation fund. The fund shall be used to compensate consumers who paid for telecommunications services that a telecommunications company failed to provide or for consumer education. Any civil fines collected pursuant to § § 49-31-7.4, 49-31-38, and 49-31-38.1 shall be credited to the consumer compensation fund which is hereby established in the state treasury. Any interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited in the fund. The money is continuously appropriated to the use of the commission to compensate consumers or provide consumer education. The commission may promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, regarding procedures on how consumers may obtain compensation from the fund or regarding methods for consumer education. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
